intro: Rhinotropis cornuta var. cornuta, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open meadows and grasslands. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Papaveraceae family.
